How many tractors have been imported from dollar areas under the International Bank dollar loan scheme! 2. Have all deliveries under the first loan scheme been received? 3. What were the (a) makes of tractors, (6) horse-power ratings and (o) types, i.e., diesel, kerosene or petrol? 4. What were the allotments to the States for (a) Government distribution and (6) private distribution? 6. Have .all deliveries to the various States been completed? Development has supplied the following answers 1 and' 2. The 100,000,000 dollar loan negotiated by the Government last August has now been fully committed in that orders have been placed for goods to the value of tiie whole loan. Delivery of these orders will continue, however, till the end of 19S2. Orders for approximately 10,000 tractors of all types have been placed. Numbers of these tractors have already been' delivered but defence orders B laced on the main manufacturers in the taited States of America, have slowed down output and deliveries are a little slower than had been hoped. ' The Government is doing all in its power to speed up delivery of tractors. 3. The makes of crawler tractors being imported are Caterpillar, International, Allis Chalmers, Cletrac and John Deere and range in power from 20 to ISO drawbar horse-power. Special types of wheel tractors are being imported mainly in the light and heavy-powered types and some high clearance models. These wheel tractors will be used almost exclusively for agricultural purposes. The mokes ordered are Allis Chalmers, Case, John Deere, International, Massey Harris, Oliver and Twin City. Most of the wheel tractors ordered are kerosenepowered but a few have diesel engines. The majority of the crawlers ordered are diesel powered. 4 and 5. The Commonwealth Government hae no control over the distribution of tractors once they are in the hands of the importers, manufacturers' agents, in each State. Government aud private users alike must obtain their tractors through the agents who consequently control the final distribution. However, licences were issued to the agents in such a way as to ensure a fair division of all tractors among the States. Statistical records are not yet available to show how many of the tractors BO far delivered have gone to each State.
